bugs.title: CVE-2024-55648 moodle: Potential denial of service risk due to guest sessions' longer timeout period [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-55648 moodle: Potential denial of service risk due to guest sessions' longer timeout period [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-55648 moodle: Potential denial of service risk due to guest sessions' longer timeout period

long_desc.thetext:
Guest user sessions were given a longer timeout than authenticated users, which could result in an elevated denial of service risk.

Versions affected: 4.5, 4.4 to 4.4.4, 4.3 to 4.3.8, 4.1 to 4.1.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Versions fixed: 4.5.1, 4.4.5, 4.3.9 and 4.1.15

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2332787

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3 (moodle-4.4.5-1.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3

FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3 has been pushed to the Fedora 41 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3 (moodle-4.4.5-1.fc41) has been pushed to the Fedora 41 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-55647 moodle: Reflected XSS in question bank filter [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-55647 moodle: Reflected XSS in question bank filter [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-55647 moodle: Reflected XSS in question bank filter

long_desc.thetext:
Question bank filtering required additional sanitizing to prevent a reflected XSS risk.

Versions affected: 4.5, 4.4 to 4.4.4 and 4.3 to 4.3.8
Versions fixed: 4.5.1, 4.4.5, and 4.3.9

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

bugs.title: CVE-2024-55646 moodle: Database activity issue in separate groups mode, for users not in a group [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-55646 moodle: Database activity issue in separate groups mode, for users not in a group [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-55646 moodle: Database activity issue in separate groups mode, for users not in a group

long_desc.thetext:
In a database activity with separate groups mode enabled, users who were not in a group (and did not have permission to access all groups) could see entries from members of all groups in the activity, rather than just entries of users also not in any groups. Note: Users within groups worked as intended, only able to see entries belonging to other members of their group(s).

Versions affected: 4.5, 4.4 to 4.4.4, 4.3 to 4.3.8, 4.1 to 4.1.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Versions fixed: 4.5.1, 4.4.5, 4.3.9 and 4.1.15

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2332781

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3 (moodle-4.4.5-1.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3

FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3 has been pushed to the Fedora 41 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-ddb5f7c0a3

bugs.title: CVE-2024-55645 moodle: Email change confirmation token available via preference [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-55645 moodle: Email change confirmation token available via preference [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-55645 moodle: Email change confirmation token available via preference

long_desc.thetext:
On sites requiring a confirmation step to update a user's email address, the token used to verify the change should only be accessible via the confirmation email, but was otherwise retrievable by the user.

Versions affected: 4.5, 4.4 to 4.4.4, 4.3 to 4.3.8, 4.1 to 4.1.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Versions fixed: 4.5.1, 4.4.5, 4.3.9 and 4.1.15

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2332780

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-55644 moodle: Tag index page displays other users tagged with the selected tag [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-55644 moodle: Tag index page displays other users tagged with the selected tag [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-55644 moodle: Tag index page displays other users tagged with the selected tag

long_desc.thetext:
Insufficient checks meant users could see users tagged with a tag, regardless of whether they had access to view the users' profiles.

Versions affected: 4.5, 4.4 to 4.4.4, 4.3 to 4.3.8, 4.1 to 4.1.14 and earlier unsupported versions
Versions fixed: 4.5.1, 4.4.5, 4.3.9 and 4.1.15

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2332778

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-55643 moodle: Unprotected access to sensitive information via learning plan web service [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-55643 moodle: Unprotected access to sensitive information via learning plan web service [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-55643 moodle: Unprotected access to sensitive information via learning plan web service

long_desc.thetext:
Insufficient capability checks in a learning plan web service could result in users having the ability to retrieve information they did not have permission to access (such as users' names).

Versions affected: 4.5, 4.4 to 4.4.4, 4.3 to 4.3.8, 4.1 to 4.1.14 and earlier unsupported versions.

Versions fixed: 4.5.1, 4.4.5, 4.3.9 and 4.1.15

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2332777

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.
